title: 112_hr3117
content: The Act is titled the "Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2012" and includes definitions. The "Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2012" defines terms such as "actual stamp" as a paper Federal migratory-bird hunting stamp, "automated licensing system" as an electronic system for issuing licenses, and "electronic stamp" as a digital version of the actual stamp. The "Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2012" defines an electronic stamp as a unique identifier issued through a State automated licensing system, compatible with the State's hunting licensing system, and approved by the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary has the authority to allow States to issue electronic stamps under this Act, in consultation with State management agencies. The Secretary must approve a State's application to issue electronic stamps under this Act. The application must include details such as the stamp format, fees, accounting process for transferring funds to the Secretary, customer data transmission, and stamp delivery method. The Secretary can limit the number of new States participating in the program each year. The State must provide details on transmitting customer data, stamp delivery, issuing duplicate stamps, and other required information to the Secretary. The Secretary will publish deadlines, eligibility requirements, and selection criteria for applications. State obligations and authorities are outlined in Section 5. The Secretary requires that individuals purchasing electronic stamps from a State must receive an actual stamp before it expires. States must collect and submit customer information and revenue from electronic stamp sales to the Secretary. The Secretary requires submission of electronic stamp sales data by States as per their agreement. States can charge a fee for issuing electronic stamps and provide duplicates for lost or damaged ones. States cannot mandate the purchase of a hunting license for electronic stamp issuance. SEC. 6. Electronic stamp requirements and recognition. The Secretary shall require an electronic stamp issued by a State to have the same format as any other license and specify identifying features of the licensee. The electronic stamp bestows the same privileges as an actual stamp, is recognized nationally, and authorizes hunting in other states. It is valid for a period not exceeding 45 days. SEC. 7. TERMINATION OF STATE PARTICIPATION. The authority of a State to issue electronic stamps under this Act may be terminated by the Secretary if the State violates terms approved in the application or by the State itself with written notice to the Secretary. Passed the House of Representatives on January 23, 2012.
